c74object.name: spat5.verdi.embedded
c74object.description: spat5.verdi is a GUI for spat5.verdi~.

attribute.name: embed
attribute.description: The embed attribute allows to store the state of the object within the patcher. The complete state of the object is stored whenever the patcher is saved to disk. Upon loading the patcher or copying the object box, the state is restored.

attribute.name: initwith
attribute.description:
The initwith attribute can be used to specify the initial state of the object. You should provide a list of comma-separated OSC commands. The list of messages should be quoted (with double quote character "). This is similar to sending the list of commands via loadbang or loadmess.
Have a look at the spat5.tuto-osc-3.maxpat example for further details.
Note that the initwith attribute cannot be set via message, attrui or inspector; it must be typed directly within the object box.

attribute.name: internals
attribute.description:
The internals attribute represents the number of internal channels of the artificial reverberator.
Spat uses a Feedback Delay Network (FDN) reverberator engine.
Basically this can be seen as an array of delay lines which are fed back into a mixing matrix. The internals attributes represents the size of the feedback matrix.
Choosing the size of this matrix is a trade-off between CPU consumption and the echo density.
Increasing the size of the matrix will generate a densier reverb tail at the expense of a higher CPU load.
A typical value of 8 is a good compromise between CPU load and natural sounding reverb. A value of 16 may be useful especially when dealing with a very long reverberation time or with very percussive sound (where a smaller FDN might sometimes sounds too poor).
It is recommended not to use a value below 6.

attribute.name: outputs
attribute.description: The outputs attribute represents the number of output channels of the object. This attribute must be set in the object box, when the object is instantiated; it can not be later set with a message (or attrui or inspector), since the number of signal inlets or outlets can not be changed dynamically.

attribute.name: parameter_enable
attribute.description: The parameter_enable attribute is used for compatibility with Max snapshots. It can also be used to store the initial state of the object (see 'Initial Enable' in the Max inspector).

method.name: /reverb/number
method.description: set the number of reverbs.

method.name: /speaker/number
method.description: set the number of speakers.

method.name: /internals
method.description: set the number of internal channels (same for all reverbs).

method.name: /reverb/[index]/tr0
method.description: set global reverberation time (in seconds).

method.name: /reverb/[index]/trl
method.description: set relative decay time in low frequencies.

method.name: /reverb/[index]/trm
method.description: set relative decay time in mid frequencies.

method.name: /reverb/[index]/trh
method.description: set relative decay time in high frequencies.

method.name: /reverb/[index]/fl
method.description: set reverb low/mid crossover frequency (in Hz).

method.name: /reverb/[index]/fh
method.description: set reverb mid/high crossover frequency (in Hz).

method.name: /reverb/[index]/infinite
method.description: enable/disable infinite reverb.

method.name: /reverb/[index]/air
method.description: enable/disable air absorption in the FDN.

method.name: /reverb/[index]/air/freq
method.description: set air absorption rolloff frequency (in Hz) in the FDN.

method.name: /reverb/[index]/delays
method.description: set the list of delays (in msec).

method.name: /reverb/[index]/delays/samples
method.description: set the list of delays (in samples).

method.name: /reverb/[index]/interpolation/mode
method.description:
set the interpolation mode.
Possible values: nearest, linear, lagrange3, allpass, hermite3, watte3, bspline3, parabolic, allpass2, allpass3, nearestxfade.

method.name: /reverb/[index]/interpolation/time
method.description: set the interpolation time (in msec).

method.name: /reverb/[index]/mute
method.description: mute this reverb.

method.name: /reverb/[index]/gain/db
method.description: set gain (in dB).

method.name: /reverb/[index]/spread
method.description: set spatial spread (in %).

method.name: /reverb/[index]/ae
method.description: set spatial direction (azimut/elevation).
